member.name: T:Symbol.Keyboard.KeyStates
member.summary: The KeyStates structure provides a list of constants used to specify changes in the Keyboard state.
member.remarks: Temporarily changed states like SHIFT, NUMLOCK are goes back to normal state after user pressed a key. To keep the state active until de-activated, a _LOCK state should be selected from the list given below. SHIFT_LOCK, NUMERIC_LOCK, FUNCTION_LOCK, ORANGE_LOCK, ORANGE_SHIFT_LOCK

member.name: F:Symbol.Keyboard.KeyStates.KEYSTATE_UNSHIFT
member.summary: Set keyboard shift key off state.

member.name: F:Symbol.Keyboard.KeyStates.KEYSTATE_SHIFT
member.summary: Set keyboard Shift key on state temporarily.

member.name: F:Symbol.Keyboard.KeyStates.KEYSTATE_SHIFT_LOCK
member.summary: Set keyboard Shift key on state permanently.

member.name: F:Symbol.Keyboard.KeyStates.KEYSTATE_CTRL
member.summary: Set keyboard Control key on state.

member.name: F:Symbol.Keyboard.KeyStates.KEYSTATE_ALT
member.summary: Set keyboard Alternate key on state.

member.name: F:Symbol.Keyboard.KeyStates.KEYSTATE_UNDEF
member.summary: This is an obsolete value. Please use KEYSTATE_ORANGE_TEMP.

member.name: F:Symbol.Keyboard.KeyStates.KEYSTATE_NUMLOCK
member.summary: Set keyboard Numlock key on state temporarily.

member.name: F:Symbol.Keyboard.KeyStates.KEYSTATE_NUMERIC_LOCK
member.summary: Set keyboard Numlock key on state permanently.

member.name: F:Symbol.Keyboard.KeyStates.KEYSTATE_CAPSLOCK
member.summary: Set keyboard CapsLock key on state.

member.name: F:Symbol.Keyboard.KeyStates.KEYSTATE_FUNC
member.summary: Set keyboard Function key on state temporarily.

member.name: F:Symbol.Keyboard.KeyStates.KEYSTATE_FUNCTION_LOCK
member.summary: Set keyboard Function key on state permanently.

member.name: F:Symbol.Keyboard.KeyStates.KEYSTATE_ORANGE_TEMP
member.summary: Set keyboard Orange key on state temporarily.

member.name: F:Symbol.Keyboard.KeyStates.KEYSTATE_ORANGE_LOCK
member.summary: Set keyboard Orange key on state permanently.

member.name: F:Symbol.Keyboard.KeyStates.KEYSTATE_ORANGE_SHIFT_LOCK
member.summary: Set keyboard Orange and Shift keys on state permanently.

member.name: T:Symbol.Keyboard.KeyPad
member.summary: The KeyPad class provides access to controllable keyboard features on Symbol mobile devices.
member.remarks: This is the main class of the Symbol.Keyboard class library. It should be used to access and control the advanced keyboard functionality on Symbol mobile devices. Not all Symbol mobile devices provide advanced keyboard functionality. Please see your hardware documentation for more information on the features of your device. A maximum of 7 KeyPad instances can be created at a time.

member.name: M:Symbol.Keyboard.KeyPad.#ctor
member.summary: Default Keypad constructor.
member.remarks: The constructor will throw a Symbol.Exception if a keyboard cannot be found. A maximum of 7 KeyPad instances can be created at a time.

member.name: M:Symbol.Keyboard.KeyPad.Finalize
member.summary: Allows a KeyPad to attempt to free resources and perform other cleanup operations before it is reclaimed by garbage collection.

member.name: M:Symbol.Keyboard.KeyPad.GetKeyStateEx
member.summary: Retrieves the current state of the keyboard modifier flags. These flags are used during the scan-code remapping process. To set the current state of the keyboard modifier flags, call SetKeyState.
member.returns: An int with one or more bits defined in KeyStates constants.
member.remarks: This method is only applicable for ES400, MC65 and MC4500 devices

member.name: M:Symbol.Keyboard.KeyPad.SetKeyState(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Establishes/activates the keyboardâ€™s state flags.
member.remarks: The key state flags are stored in a shared address space, allowing individual threads the ability to change the state of the flags. When this method is called, keyboard interrupts are disabled, preventing the keyboard driver from accessing invalid flag information while the flags are being updated. The state of the keyboard, as known by CE, is set to a default state (Caps Lock and Num Lock are reset). The flags are then updated, and CE is issued keybd_event commands to synchronize CE to the new flags.
member.param: An int with one or more bits defined in KeyStates constants. For the valid combinations, please see the Remarks section.
The remapping table selector, a single bit of those set in state. This is not used and must be set to 0.
A boolean flag requesting the registry to be updated. For the valid combinations, please see the Remarks section.

member.name: M:Symbol.Keyboard.KeyPad.Dispose
member.summary: Frees up all resources used by the KeyPad class, including any objects it has created. It is strongly recommended that this method be called when the KeyPad is no longer needed by the application.

member.name: P:Symbol.Keyboard.KeyPad.AlphaMode
member.summary: Gets or sets the Alpha mode.
member.remarks: On some of the newer devices AlphaMode cannot be set. You must use (#,#) instead.
member.value: A boolean flag that specifies whether the Alpha mode is on or not.

member.name: P:Symbol.Keyboard.KeyPad.KeyLiteMode
member.summary: Gets or sets the Key Lite mode.
member.value: enumerated type that specifies the state of the key light.
member.remarks: needs to be set before setting the KeyLiteMode to KeyLite_State_Timeout.

member.name: P:Symbol.Keyboard.KeyPad.KeyLiteTimeout
member.summary: Gets or sets the Key Lite timeout value.
member.value: An Integer that specifies the key light timeout in milliseconds.
member.remarks: Minimum value is 1000 (milliseconds) and it is used only when the is set to >. Value 0 is used for other modes.

member.name: P:Symbol.Keyboard.KeyPad.Version
member.summary: Gets a Version object of the keyboard class library.
member.value: A object that contains keyboard version information.

member.name: E:Symbol.Keyboard.KeyPad.AlphaNotify
member.summary: Provides access to the events generated when Alpha mode has changed.
member.value: A delegate of the method that will be invoked when a keyboard alpha mode event occurs.

member.name: E:Symbol.Keyboard.KeyPad.KeyStateNotify
member.summary: Provides access to the events generated when KeyState has changed.
member.value: A delegate of the method that will be invoked when the keyboard state event occurs.

member.name: T:Symbol.Keyboard.KeyPad.KeyboardEventHandler
member.summary: Delegate of the event handler for keyboard events.

member.name: T:Symbol.Keyboard.KeyboardEventArgs
member.summary: The KeyboardEventArgs class defines arguments passed to keyboard notification events.
member.remarks: KeyboardEventHandler methods will be passed a KeyboardEventArgs object. This object provides information about the event that has occured. This class is not normally constructed by the application developer.

member.name: M:Symbol.Keyboard.KeyboardEventArgs.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: KeyboardEventArgs constructor with settable wParam and lParam.

member.name: P:Symbol.Keyboard.KeyboardEventArgs.KeyState
member.summary: The current Keystate of the keyboard.

member.name: P:Symbol.Keyboard.KeyboardEventArgs.ActiveModifier
member.summary: The current active modifier of the keyboard.
member.value: An integer that specifies the current active modifier for the keyboard.

member.name: T:Symbol.Keyboard.KeyLight
member.summary: The KeyLight class provides control over the keyboard backlight of the device. NOTE: This feature is currently available for the VC6090 device only.

member.name: M:Symbol.Keyboard.KeyLight.#ctor
member.summary: KeyLight constructor

member.name: M:Symbol.Keyboard.KeyLight.Finalize
member.summary: KeyLight destructor.

member.name: M:Symbol.Keyboard.KeyLight.Dispose
member.summary: Dispose method

member.name: P:Symbol.Keyboard.KeyLight.SupportedIntensityLevels
member.summary: Gets the number of supported keylight intensity levels. NOTE: This property is currently available for the VC6090 device only.

member.name: P:Symbol.Keyboard.KeyLight.IntensityLevel
member.summary: Controls the keylight intensity level. When setting the intensity level, this value must be between 0 and maximum level(SupportedIntensityLevels minus 1). NOTE: This property is currently available for the VC6090 device only.

member.name: P:Symbol.Keyboard.KeyLight.State
member.summary: Gets or sets the keylight state. NOTE: This property is currently available for the VC6090 device only.

member.name: T:Symbol.Keyboard.KeyLight.KEYLIGHT_STATES
member.summary: Defines the possible Keylight states

member.name: F:Symbol.Keyboard.KeyLight.KEYLIGHT_STATES.KEYLIGHT_OFF
member.summary: Keylight is OFF

member.name: F:Symbol.Keyboard.KeyLight.KEYLIGHT_STATES.KEYLIGHT_ON
member.summary: Keylight is ON

member.name: T:Symbol.Keyboard.KeyLight.KEYLIGHT_RESULTS
member.summary: Possible result codes of the Keylight operations

member.name: F:Symbol.Keyboard.KeyLight.KEYLIGHT_RESULTS.E_KLT_SUCCESS
member.summary: Operation succeeded

member.name: F:Symbol.Keyboard.KeyLight.KEYLIGHT_RESULTS.E_KLT_ERROR
member.summary: Operation failed

member.name: F:Symbol.Keyboard.KeyLight.KEYLIGHT_RESULTS.E_KLT_STRUCTINFO
member.summary: The STRUCT_INFO structure field is invalid. Either dwAllocated or dwUsed is less than the size of STRUCT_INFO, or dwUsed greater than dwAllocted.

member.name: F:Symbol.Keyboard.KeyLight.KEYLIGHT_RESULTS.E_KLT_MISSINGFIELD
member.summary: The size of a structure specified in a STRUCT_INFO is too small to contain a required field, or the field does not exist.

member.name: F:Symbol.Keyboard.KeyLight.KEYLIGHT_RESULTS.E_KLT_PWRFAILED
member.summary: A call to the power management API failed.

member.name: F:Symbol.Keyboard.KeyLight.KEYLIGHT_RESULTS.E_KLT_NOTSUPPORTED
member.summary: Operation is not supported.

member.name: F:Symbol.Keyboard.KeyLight.KEYLIGHT_RESULTS.E_KLT_NULLPTR
member.summary: A NULL pointer was passed for a required argument.
